DOC.brief_summary: To define evaluate OCT stent guidance parameter prospective data collection PCI procedures de novo lesion .
DOC.brief_title: Observational Study Optical Coherence Tomography ( OCT ) Patients Undergoing Fractional Flow Reserve ( FFR ) Percutaneous Coronary Intervention
DOC.criteria: 1 . Age ≥ 18 year . 2 . Patient provide sign write informed consent studyspecific procedure . 3 . De novo coronary artery disease target vessel . 4 . Single multi vessel disease . For multi vessel disease two vessel three lesion treat , two lesion per vessel . Vessel define , leave anterior descending , leave circumflex , right coronary artery . Any branch within vessel consider part vessel . 5 . Elective ad hoc PCI , stable angina , acute coronary syndrome ( unstable angina NSTEMI ) . 6 . Angiographically significant ( > 50 % visual estimation ) stenosis present least one native coronary artery . 7 . Mandatory use FFR OCT pre post PCI . PCI strongly recommend subject FFR ≤ 0.80 target vessel . 1 . Subjects STEMI , emergent PCI , cardiogenic shock . 2 . Subjects target leave main lesion . 3 . Subjects restenosis stent thrombosis target vessel . 4 . Planned use bare metal stent . 5 . Known renal insufficiency ( example limit eGFR < 60 ml/kg/m2 , serum creatinine ≥ 2.5 mg/dL , dialysis ) . 6 . Aortoostial lesion location within 3 mm aorta junction ( right left ) . 7 . Extreme angulation ( > 90° ) excessive tortuosity ( > two 45° angle ) proximal within target lesion . 8 . Vessel ( ) lesion ( ) amenable PCI , example diffuse disease . 9 . Any medical condition opinion investigator interfere patient safety study result . 10 . Currently participate another clinical study interferes study result . 11 . Pregnant nursing subject plan pregnancy period 1 year follow index procedure . 12 . Life expectancy less 1 year . 13 . Potential noncompliance protocol requirement followup . 14 . Planned prior heart transplantation list heart transplant . 15 . Any condition precludes subject undergoing PCI , example subject heparin induce thrombocytopenia , contrast allergy .
